identificationModule.briefTitle: A Psychoeducational Intervention for Stroke Family Caregivers
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effects of a Psychoeducational Intervention on Stroke Family Caregiver Outcomes and the Use of Health and Social Services Among Stroke Survivors: A Randomized Controlled Trial

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: PhD (Nursing) candidate, BN, PgD (Mental Health), RN

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a randomized controlled trial with a 3-month psychoeducational program as intervention, followed by a 3 month observational period. The purpose of this study was to examine whether a psychoeducational program focusing on equipping caregivers with problem-solving skills would improve caregiver's problem-solving abilities, their psychological responses and caregiving resources, and would minimize the use of health and social services among stroke survivors.

armGroups.label: Psychoeducational program
armGroups.description: Psychoeducational program consisted of (1) two inpatient sessions of face-to-face education on stroke and its caregiving; (2) six biweekly problem-solving training via telephone contacts after the discharge of stroke survivors

primaryOutcomes.measure: Caregivers' change in depressive symptom severity from baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in depressive symptoms severity, as measured by the 10-item Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression (Chinese version), will be analyzed by the GEE model

primaryOutcomes.measure: Caregiver's change in perceived mental health from baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in perceived mental health, as measured by the Chinese (Hong Kong) Medical Outcomes Study 12-item Short Form Health Survey version 2 (SF-12v2), its mental component summary score will be analyzed by the GEE model
End-point between-group differences of the caregiving burden, as measured by the Caregiving Strain Index (Chinese version), will be analyzed by multiple regression analysis

primaryOutcomes.measure: Caregiver's change in caregiving competence from baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in caregiving competence, as measured by the Caregiving Competence Scale (Chinese version), will be analyzed by the GEE model

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Caregiver's change in self-appraised problem-solving abilities from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in self-appraised problem-solving abilities, as measured by the Problem Solving Inventory (Chinese version), will be analyzed using the Generalized Estimating Equations (GEE) model

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Caregiver's change in family functioning from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in family functioning, as measured by the McMaster Model of Family Assessment Device (Chinese version), will be analyzed using the GEE model

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Caregiver's change in perceived social support from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in perceived social support, as measured by the Six-item Social Support Questionnaire (Chinese version), will be analyzed using the GEE model

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Caregiver's change in perceived physical health from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in perceived physical health, as measured by the Chinese (Hong Kong) SF-12v2 (Physical Component Summary Score), will be analyzed by the GEE model
End-point between-group differences of the self-reported caregiving related injuries will be analyzed using Chi square statistics
End-point between-group differences of the self-reported stroke-related hospital readmission, such as falls, recurrent stroke, will be analyzed using Chi square statistics

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Placement to residential/nursing care home (stroke survivors)
secondaryOutcomes.description: End-point between-group differences of the placement to residential/nursing care home of stroke survivors will be analyzed by the Chi square statistics

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria (caregiver):

* Family member of stroke survivor
* Chinese adult
* Live with stroke survivors
* Primary caregiver
* Being able to communicate with the researcher

Inclusion Criteria (stroke survivor):

* Chinese adult with diagnosis of stroke
* Live at home after discharge
* Being able to understand and to give consent

Exclusion Criteria (caregiver and stroke survivor):

* History of self-reported doctor-diagnosed psychiatric illness
* (stroke survivor): being mild to totally independent
